body: The Indonesian ceramic industry's production volume increased in the first half of 2025, driven by a rise in utilization rates to 70-71% from 60% in the same period last year. The higher utilization rate led to a surge in national ceramic production, according to the Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association (Asaki).

PT Telkom Indonesia Tbk (TLKM) reported a revenue of IDR 36.63 trillion in March 2025, a 2.11% year-over-year decline from IDR 37.42 trillion in the same period last year. The company is seeking to capitalize on the school holiday period to boost traffic and sales of its starter packs.

The Indonesian stock market closed at 6,900 on Monday, up 0.52% from the previous Friday, with low trading volume and value due to investor caution amid global uncertainty. Locally, weak motorcycle sales reflected declining consumer purchasing power.

Indonesia's manufacturing sector remains under pressure in June 2025, with the Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) falling to 46.9, indicating a contraction in the sector. Analysts expect the sector to continue facing challenges in the short term, but see potential for recovery in the second half of 2025, driven by government spending and domestic consumption.

PT Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul Tbk (SIDO) aims to achieve high single-digit to double-digit sales growth in 2025, driven by new product launches and market expansion. The company's performance was affected by several factors in Q1 2025, including the earlier Eid al-Fitr holiday and shorter working days, which impacted logistics and consumption.

The Indonesian government has introduced a new regulation to optimize digital economy taxation through a digital transaction tax system, with PT Jalin Pembayaran Nusantara (BUMN) appointed as the main operator. The system aims to improve tax collection from global digital economic activities.

PT Bumi Resources Tbk (BUMI) is set to issue IDR 350 billion bonds in three series to support its expansion plans for the rest of 2025, with the proceeds to be used to partially fund the acquisition of Wolfram Limited, an Australian gold and copper mining company. The bonds have received an IDR+ rating from Pemeringkat Efek Indonesia.

The Indonesian government, central bank, and international institutions have presented varying estimates of economic growth projections for 2026, ranging from optimistic to cautious. The estimates were presented to the House of Representatives by the Ministry of Finance, Ministry of National Development Planning, and Bank Indonesia.

US President Donald Trump has delayed the implementation of import tariffs until August 1, 2025, causing a depreciation of major currencies against the US dollar. The move, along with Trump's threat to BRICS nations, has grabbed market attention and impacted global sentiment.

PT Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya Tbk (BKPJ) has started a comprehensive due diligence process as part of its plan to acquire a majority stake in PT Bangun Karya Artha Lestari from Rich Step International Ltd and other parties. The acquisition is a significant step forward for BKPJ's growth strategy.

Bank Indonesia reported that the country's foreign exchange reserves stood at $152.6 billion as of the end of June 2025, a slight increase from $152.5 billion in May 2025, amid global uncertainty that poses a risk to the country's external stability.

The US government has extended trade negotiations with several countries, including Indonesia, until August 2025, potentially leading to a double-edged sword for Jakarta. Indonesia is willing to roll out the red carpet for imports in hopes that Washington will lower its reciprocal tariffs, which were initially set at 32%.

As of April 2025, Indonesian life insurance companies have invested IDR 210.25 trillion in government bonds, accounting for 40.19% of their total investments. This represents an increase from the previous year's 37.97% or IDR 196.17 trillion.

PT Indokripto Koin Semesta Tbk's initial public offering (IPO) has received high enthusiasm from potential investors, with the offering being oversubscribed by more than 70 times during the offering period from Wednesday to Monday. The strong demand indicates a successful IPO for the company.

Indonesian banks' holdings of government securities have increased by 16.46% to IDR 1.224 trillion as of July 2, 2025, according to the Directorate General of Budget Financing and Risk Management. Despite this, some banks have reallocated their assets to expand credit.

The Indonesian government plans to impose export tariffs on gold and coal starting 2026, aiming to increase customs and excise revenue to 1.18-1.30% of the country's gross domestic product. This move is part of the government's efforts to boost revenue and meet its 2026 budget targets.

The Indonesian Anti-Corruption Commission is investigating alleged corruption in the procurement of electronic data capture devices at PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BRI) between 2023-2024, involving high-ranking officials. The case is a rare instance of fraud in a major bank, which typically involves fictitious credit or loan schemes.

PT Kawasan Industri Jababeka Tbk (KIJA) is optimistic about the prospects of industrial estates in Indonesia, driven by the trend of industrial relocation and demand from global investors, particularly from Asia. The company plans to accelerate sales conversion, strengthen infrastructure and utilities, and develop new zones for healthcare, education, and tourism sectors.

The Indonesian Ministry of Industry has inaugurated a pilot project to produce palm sugar from old oil palm trees, aiming to accelerate downstreaming of the palm oil industry and empower local economies. The project has the potential to produce 1.5-1.9 million kiloliters of palm sugar per year, with an estimated market value of around IDR 3.0 trillion.

A recent study reveals that oil palm plantations are not the primary cause of deforestation in Indonesia, with only 15% of deforestation attributed to them between 2000-2022. Instead, most deforestation occurred prior to 2000, with 37% of forest areas converted for other agricultural purposes and the remaining 48% for mining, settlements, and infrastructure.

The price of 24-karat gold bars produced by PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) decreased by Rp 7,000 per gram, from Rp 1,908,000 to Rp 1,901,000 per gram, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 7,000 per gram, from Rp 1,752,000 to Rp 1,745,000 per gram.

Foreign institutional investors, led by JP Morgan, bought shares of PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO) in early July 2025, contributing to the rebound of the company's stock. The stock price is expected to potentially return to IDR 100 per share.

Banking stocks are no longer the dominant players in Indonesia's top 10 market capitalization list, with commodities and petrochemical stocks gaining ground. PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) remains at the top of the list, but the list is becoming more diversified across various sectors.

Digital banks in Indonesia have reported higher profit growth, with most of them experiencing double-digit growth, according to financial reports as of May 2025. In contrast, conventional banks are struggling to maintain profitability.

Indonesian nickel miners are facing challenges due to weakening commodity prices and China's anti-dumping policy, which imposes a 20.2% tariff on Indonesian nickel products. This policy is expected to impact Indonesian nickel miners, who rely heavily on exports to China.

Several Indonesian banks, including Bank Panin (PNBN), have reported growth in their cash management businesses in the first half of the year, with Bank Panin processing 1.91 million transactions worth IDR 96.2 trillion. The growth is expected to increase non-interest income and attract low-cost funds.

The Indonesian stock market's IHSG index closed the week with a 0.19% decline to 6,865.19, with a daily transaction value of IDR 7.96 trillion, lower than the average daily transaction value of IDR 13.16 trillion in 2025. Foreign investors continued to sell, with a net sell value of IDR 2.78 trillion, contributing to the decline.

The performance of Indonesian industrial property issuers is expected to be pressured in the second half of the year due to global sentiment, with factors such as trade tariffs, dollar index decline, and geopolitical tensions affecting investment and trade activities. PT Jababeka Tbk (JABEKA) cited these factors as creating uncertainty in the investment climate.

Russian President Vladimir Putin has offered Indonesia cooperation in nuclear energy for peaceful purposes, including development in healthcare, agriculture, and training, during President Prabowo Subianto's visit to Russia on June 19-20, 2025. The offer comes as Russia's state-owned Rosatom has already proposed building nuclear power plants in Indonesia, with 100% financing.

The Indonesian government is set to launch the Red-White Village Cooperative Program on July 19, 2025, with hundreds of cooperatives scheduled to start the trial phase, although the official funding scheme has not been finalized. State-owned banks are expected to be the main source of funding for the program.

Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara has received a $10 billion investment commitment from ACWA Power, a Saudi Arabia-based private desalination company and green hydrogen pioneer. The investment agreement was announced during President Prabowo Subianto's two-day visit to Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.

PT Arsy Buana Travelindo TBK (IDX: unknown) reported a positive performance in Q1 2025, with growth compared to the same period last year, despite global uncertainty due to the escalation of conflicts in the Middle East and the ongoing impact of the global economic slowdown. The company's performance was driven by its hajj and umrah travel business.

The Indonesian poultry sector is expected to improve in the second half of 2025 driven by better live bird prices, lower grand parent stock imports in 2024, and government spending support. Analyst Ekky Topan from Infovesta Kapital Advisori notes that the sector's prospects are driven by factors such as the gradual recovery of broiler and day old chick prices since May-June 2025.

The dominance of banking stocks in Indonesia's top 10 market capitalization list is fading, with commodities and petrochemical stocks now represented. The list is becoming more diversified, with banking stocks no longer holding all top 10 spots.

PT Pertamina International Shipping (PIS) will operate 102 integrated vessels in 2024 to ensure safe and timely energy distribution, transporting 161 billion liters of energy last year. The company has significantly reduced transport loss, achieving a rate of 0.009% in 2024, an 87.1% decrease from the previous year.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) may continue its correction on Monday, driven by sentiment from the US tariff policy, after falling 0.19% to 6,865.19 on Friday. The index is expected to move sideways in a narrow range, with lower trading volume and value compared to the daily average.

Department stores in Indonesia are expected to face challenges in the second half of 2025 due to changes in consumer spending habits and decreased purchasing power among middle-class consumers. Despite increased foot traffic in shopping centers, department stores are struggling to stay afloat, with several major brands such as Lotus, Centro, and Golden Truly having already closed down.

The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources is revising the regulation on submitting work plans and budget proposals for mineral and coal mining permit holders from every three years to once a year. The revision aims to improve the efficiency of the mining industry in Indonesia.

BPJS Kesehatan, Indonesia's social health insurance provider, reported a deficit of IDR 7.14 trillion in 2024, driven by increasing healthcare burden and operational costs. To address the deficit, the government may consider increasing BPJS Kesehatan premiums next year.

The Indonesian rupiah is predicted to weaken against the US dollar on Monday due to concerns over trade tariffs, after strengthening 0.32% to Rp 16,185 on Friday. The rupiah has been volatile amidst trade tensions, with a planned 20-50% import tariff set to take effect on July 9.

The Indonesian rupiah has strengthened 0.062% against the US dollar in the past week, reaching a level of Rp 16,185, and has gained 2.89% in the past three months, according to Bloomberg data. The greenback is expected to continue weakening in Q3-2025 due to escalating political tensions.

Indonesia's import of raw materials and supporting goods increased by 3.65% year-over-year to $69.40 billion in the first five months of 2025, while import of capital goods surged 17.67% to $18.82 billion. Meanwhile, import of consumer goods declined 3.21% to $8.38 billion during the same period.

The Indonesian government is investigating why medium and premium rice prices remain high despite increased national production, with prices still above the highest retail price limit. The government has taken stern measures against violators and is conducting an investigation to address the anomaly.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) declined 0.47% in the first week of July 2025, closing at 6,865.19 on July 4, 2025, with large-cap stocks weighing down the index. The index only strengthened on Monday and then weakened over the next four trading days.

PT Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya TBK (BKPK) has undergone a share acquisition by several electric vehicle companies, with Brigitta Notoatmodjo and Pramana Budihardjo selling their shares at IDR 29 per share, resulting in a decrease in their ownership stake from 13.87% to 5.88%. The shares were sold to PT Huashang Investment Group and PT Cahaya Intan Niaga.

PT Bumi Resources Minerals TBK (BRMS) is expected to double its gold production to 150,000 ounces by 2028, driven by the accumulation of gold production and support from underground mining by PT Citra Palu Mineral and Gorontalo Minerals. The company's underground mine, CPM, is set to complete its heap leach process in Q3-2025.

The Indonesian government has announced the deregulation of its import policy, which is expected to boost the prospects of industrial issuers. The new policy is seen as a positive sentiment, allowing businesses to smooth out their supply chains and access previously restricted raw materials, production components, and consumer goods.

The proposal of the US tax and budget plan by President Donald Trump has put pressure on the US dollar, causing the rupiah to strengthen to Rp 16,195 per dollar, a 0.32% increase from the previous day.

PT United Tractors Tbk's (UNTR) mining performance is expected to be affected by weather conditions and coal prices, resulting in a 12% year-over-year decline in coal production volume in the first five months of 2025. The company's production target of 1.15 million bcm for 2025 is also at risk of not being met.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia increased by IDR 1,000 per gram, from IDR 1,907,000 to IDR 1,908,000, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 1,000 per gram, from IDR 1,751,000 to IDR 1,752,000. This increase is reflected in the prices offered by Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM).

PT Adi Sarana Armada Tbk (ASSA) is set to strengthen its 22-year-old automotive business with a capital expenditure of Rp 1.3-1.5 trillion in 2025, mainly to boost its rental car business by purchasing new vehicles. The investment is expected to enhance the company's competitiveness in the industry.

The gold price has increased by 2.09% in a week, reaching $3,342.9 per ounce, while Antam's gold price remains stagnant at Rp 1,907 million per gram. Despite the uncertainty, experts remain optimistic about gold as a safe-haven asset.

The Rupiah strengthened 0.06% to IDR 16,185 per dollar on Friday, and 0.17% over the week, according to Bloomberg and Jisdor Bank Indonesia data. The currency's slight strengthening is a positive sign for the Indonesian economy.

The Indonesian government aims to increase the number of beneficiaries of its free nutritious food program to 20 million by August 2025, up from 5.59 million as of July 1, with a planned additional budget of IDR 50 trillion to optimize the program's implementation. The program targets to reach 82 million beneficiaries by the end of 2025.

PT Yupi Indo Jelly Gum Tbk (YUPI) has ended its dividend distribution period, allowing investors who purchased shares before the cum-date to receive a cash dividend of IDR 503.29 billion, approximately 80% of the company's net profit for 2024. The dividend payout was approved during the company's annual general meeting of shareholders last week.

Indonesian coal exporters are facing challenges due to weak demand in the export market, with national coal exports valued at $10.26 billion in January-May 2025, a 19.1% year-over-year decline. The volume of coal exports also decreased by 4.65% to 156.37 million tons during the same period.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) fell 0.19% to 6,865.19 on Friday, marking a 0.47% decline for the week, with foreign investors selling a net Rp 2.78 trillion worth of shares. The decline was driven by selling pressure from investors, according to Herditya Wicaksana, Head of Research at MNC Sekuritas.

PT Kustodian Sentral Efek Indonesia reported that 40.6% of investors attended virtual shareholder meetings held by listed companies in June 2025, using the Electronic General Meeting System or Easy.KSEI platform. This marks a significant increase in virtual meeting participation.

PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk (SURGE) is set to conduct a rights issue, with PT Investasi Sukses Bersama, its majority shareholder, acting as the standby buyer. The move aims to increase the company's capital, with details of the issue to be announced later.

PT Bukalapak.com Tbk (BUKA) is set to allocate IDR 1.13 trillion for a share buyback program without requiring approval from a general meeting of shareholders. The program is in accordance with Financial Services Authority (OJK) regulations.

The IDX Infrastructure index has corrected 5.34% since the start of 2025, with telecommunication subsector stocks, such as PT Indosat Tbk (ISAT), being a major drag, falling 11.46% since the beginning of the year. Senior equity research at Kiwoom Sekuritas Indonesia expects the sector to remain weak in the second half of 2025.

PT Sampoerna Agro Tbk (SGRO) aims to achieve 5% annual growth in fresh fruit bunch production by the end of 2025, driven by its target to boost performance in the remaining year. The company is focused on increasing its crude palm oil production to meet its growth targets.

Cement producers in Indonesia struggled in the first half of 2023 due to oversupply in the domestic market, which is expected to continue unless the government's infrastructure and housing programs improve. The sector's performance is being weighed down by this excess supply, with no clear signs of recovery.

Vastland Indonesia (VAST) is set to maximize its performance this year through strategic initiatives, including expanding into the cold chain industry, and has recently signed a contract with a major food and beverage distributor in Indonesia. The company aims to boost its performance through these new initiatives.

The Indonesian financial authority, OJK, has postponed the implementation of a new health insurance regulation after reaching an agreement with the Parliament. The regulation, which was initially introduced in a circular, will be reformed into a new OJK regulation to strengthen the health insurance ecosystem.

PT Siantar Top TBK (STTP) reported a 4.13% year-over-year increase in sales to IDR 1.26 trillion in Q1 2025, but its net profit dropped 40.14% to IDR 302.13 billion. The company is preparing strategies to boost sales in the second half of 2025.

Bank Indonesia reported a 1.9% year-over-year growth in micro, small, and medium enterprise (MSME) credit disbursement to IDR 1,401.2 trillion as of May 2025, with PT Bank BCA Syariah (BCA) experiencing a decline in MSME financing to IDR 1.5 trillion, down from IDR 1.6 trillion in the same period last year.

PT Merdeka Copper Gold's (MDKA) shares rose 4.76% to IDR 2,090 per share on Thursday, driven by speculation on rising gold prices. Analysts recommend buying the stock, with a target price of IDR 2,500-2,700 per share, citing the company's positive financial performance and gold price trends.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 2,000 per gram, from Rp 1,913,000 to Rp 1,911,000, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 4,000 per gram, from Rp 1,755,000 to Rp 1,751,000, according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang. This marks a decline in gold prices in the country.

The Indonesian property industry is expected to remain strong in the second half of 2023, driven by supportive policies that can accelerate property sales, according to Bambang Ekajaya, Vice Chairman of the Indonesian Real Estate Association (REI). The industry is expected to continue growing, with a positive outlook for the rest of the year.

PT Sarinah (no ticker) aims to achieve maximal performance this year through its business transformation strategy, Sarinah 2.0, which focuses on becoming a cultural experience center. The company targets growing revenue, with retail remaining a key growth pillar, and plans to expand its reach beyond Thamrin and explore wider collaborations.

PT Segar Kumala Indonesia Tbk (SAHAM) is aggressively expanding its fresh fruit distribution network across Indonesia, with plans to open new branches and strengthen storage facilities by 2025. The company has recently opened two new branches in Jayapura and Ternate, aiming to reach the eastern regions of Indonesia, which have been logistically challenging.

PT Digital Mediatama Maxima Tbk (DMMX) targets double-digit revenue growth in 2025, despite a 43.28% year-over-year decline in revenue to IDR 190.75 billion in Q1-2025. The company plans to implement various strategies to improve performance and expand its market in the second half of 2025.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.32% against the US dollar to reach IDR 16,195 per dollar, driven by hopes of a new trade deal. The currency also rose 0.17% based on the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (Jisdor) to IDR 16,209.

PT Pakuwon Jati Tbk (PWON) reported a disappointing Q1 performance due to a decline in property business revenue and losses from foreign exchange and investments, resulting in a net profit decline. However, the company plans to expand its business with a capital expenditure of IDR 2.48 trillion by 2025, with 59% allocated for construction and 41% for acquisitions.

PT Gajah Tunggal Tbk (GJTL) will distribute IDR 174.22 billion in cash dividends, equivalent to 14.75% of its net profit of IDR 1.18 trillion in 2024, with each investor receiving IDR 50 per share, representing a potential dividend yield of 4.48%.

The Indonesian ceramic industry's production utilization rate reached 70-71% in H1 2025, up from 60% in H1 2024, according to Edy Suyanto, Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association. Despite this growth, the industry still faces challenges in optimizing production and sales.

The Indonesian government is negotiating with the US to increase imports of oil and agricultural products in response to the US's 40% reciprocal tariff on Indonesian products. The government plans to sign a memorandum of understanding with the US to boost imports, according to Minister of Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto.

Lenders on Akseleran, a fintech lending platform, are still waiting for repayment from six borrowers, including PT PPD, which claims it is unable to pay due to unpaid invoices from Bohir for several projects. The total amount stuck is not disclosed, but lenders are seeking clarity on the repayment status.

Indonesia's non-tax state revenue is expected to reach only IDR 477.2 trillion, 92.9% of the 2025 target, due to the transfer of state-owned enterprise dividend management to the Investment Management Institute. The revenue from state wealth is predicted to reach only IDR 11.8 trillion, down from the initial target of IDR 90 trillion.

The Indonesian government has disbursed Rp 131.84 trillion in loans to the production sector, accounting for 45% of this year's target of Rp 300 trillion, to strengthen food and housing resilience. The loan disbursement is dominated by the production sector, according to Minister of Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto.

PT Sarana Menara Nusantara Tbk (TOWR) is planning to raise up to IDR 5.49 trillion through a rights issue, offering around 8.03 billion new shares at IDR 680 per share. The company will use the proceeds to strengthen its capital structure and support its business growth.

Indonesia is set to implement sustainability disclosure standards by January 2027, following the adoption of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) Sustainability Disclosure S1 and S2. The move is expected to bring about a new era in sustainability reporting, with companies, especially financial institutions, issuers, and public companies, required to disclose climate-related information in a more systematic manner.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) closed 0.05% lower at 6,878.05, driven by declines in technology, financial, and industrial stocks, with foreign investors net selling IDR 31.31 billion worth of shares.

Despite the Financial Services Authority's (OJK) relaxation of credit limits to IDR 10 billion, multifinance companies have seen little interest from borrowers, citing uncertain economic conditions and hesitant business expansion. The OJK's Regulation No. 46/2024, effective since early March, aimed to increase working capital financing but has yet to yield significant results.

The Indonesian stock market index closed 0.05% lower at 6,878.05, with foreign investors net selling IDR 31.31 billion worth of shares. The decline was minimal, but still marked a negative trend in the market.

Bangkok Bank and Permata Bank have reiterated their commitment to supporting Thai investors in their investment journey in Indonesia, with Permata Bank's network of 200 branches in Indonesia set to provide advisory support and facilitate trade and investment. High-potential industries include the food and beverage sector, which has a market value exceeding $280 billion.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 2,000 per gram to Rp 1,911,000 per gram, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 2,000 per gram to Rp 1,755,000 per gram, according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang. This marks a decline in gold prices in the country.

ExxonMobil (XOM) has reaffirmed its commitment to invest $10 billion in Indonesia, following a meeting between Indonesian Minister of Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto and ExxonMobil Indonesia's new CEO Wade Floyd. The investment aims to strengthen strategic cooperation in the energy sector, industrial downstreaming, and low-carbon economy transition.

The Indonesian parliament's Commission XI has approved Ricky Perdana Gozali as the Deputy Governor of Bank Indonesia for the 2025-2030 period, replacing Doni Primanto Joewono whose term ends in July. Gozali was chosen after passing a fit and proper test, beating out another candidate, Dicky Kartikoyono.

PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk's (MEDC) subsidiaries, Medco E&P Grissik Ltd and Far East Energy Trading Pte Ltd, have signed credit agreements with international banks on June 26, 2025, securing new financing facilities. The agreements are expected to support the company's future operations and growth plans.

Indonesia's tax revenue for 2025 is expected to fall short of its target, with a projected shortfall of 5.1% compared to the previous year, according to the Ministry of Finance's data. The government's outlook predicts tax revenue to reach only IDR 2,076.9 trillion, or 94.9% of the target.

As the annual shareholders' meeting season comes to an end, several Indonesian companies, mostly from the second and third tiers, are distributing dividends with yields over 5%. However, investors are advised to consider the liquidity of these companies before investing.

Eight companies, including PT Chandra Daya Investasi TBK, PT Indokripto Koin Semesta TBK, PT Prima Multi Usaha Indonesia TBK, and PT Merry Riana Edukasi TBK, are set to list on the Indonesia Stock Exchange through initial public offerings from July 8 to 10. This move is expected to boost the Indonesian stock market.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 0.49% to 6,881.24 on Wednesday, driven by foreign investor outflows of IDR 1.23 trillion. The decline was also influenced by the release of Indonesia's manufacturing PMI data, which showed a contraction in the national manufacturing industry for three consecutive months.

As the annual shareholders' meeting season comes to an end, Indonesian companies are distributing dividends, with some second- and third-tier emitters offering yields above 5%. Investors are advised to consider liquidity when investing in these dividend-paying companies.

Indonesian blue chip stocks and conglomerates suffered significant corrections in the first semester of 2025, with PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (BART) leading the decline with a 36.66% drop, followed by PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PIKD) with a 29.38% fall. Other notable decliners included PT Alamtri Resources Indonesia Tbk (ALTO), PT United Tractors Tbk (UNTR), and PT Goto Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO).

The Indonesian poultry industry is projected to recover in the second half of 2025, which will maintain the positive performance trend of PT Charoen Phokphand Indonesia Tbk (CPIN) in the early part of the year. This recovery is expected to have a positive impact on the company's financial performance.

PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk's (MEDC) subsidiaries, Medco E&P Grissik Ltd and Far East Energy Trading Pte Ltd, have secured credit facilities from international banks, with Medco Energi acting as the guarantor. The deal was signed on June 26, 2025, with the subsidiaries acting as borrowers.

PT PP (PTPP) reported a 23.9% year-over-year decline in revenue to IDR 3.51 trillion in Q1 2025, primarily due to slower construction activity during the Ramadan and Lebaran period. The company plans to offset this decline by divesting some of its assets.

The Indonesian bond market is expected to stabilize in the second half of 2025 due to expectations of monetary easing in both Indonesia and the US, with Bank Indonesia playing a significant role in supporting the market. However, there is a potential for investors to rotate into riskier assets, driven by expectations of interest rate cuts and lingering global uncertainty.

PT Prodia Widyahusada Tbk (PROD) has acquired a 30% stake in its affiliate company PT Prodia Stemcell Indonesia, a regenerative therapy-based company, for a total transaction value of IDR 33 billion. The acquisition is part of the company's corporate actions, with Prodia acquiring 69,512 shares of Prostem.

PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk and PT Merdeka Battery Materials Tbk reported losses in Q1 2025, with revenue decreasing by 7.18% year-over-year to US$502.17 million. Meanwhile, the net loss of MDKA decreased by 75.44% year-over-year to US$3.74 million.

The Indonesian financial authority, Otoritas Jasa Keuangan, met with Ajaib Sekuritas (no ticker) to discuss a recent margin trading issue that resulted in a retail investor receiving a IDR 1.8 billion bill. Ajaib Sekuritas assured the authority that all customer funds and transactions are safe and secure.

In the first half of 2025, recurring income was a key driver of performance for property emitters, with companies like PT Pakuwon Jati Tbk (PWON) and PT Summarecon Agung Tbk generating significant revenue from recurring income. However, in the second half of the year, the trend may reverse as housing sales are expected to improve.

PT Energi Mega Persada Tbk's stock has been boosted by the positive sentiment surrounding Bakrie Group stocks, which have been rising since the start of the year. The company's improving fundamentals and corporate actions have also contributed to the stock's growth.

PT Sanurhasta Mitra Tbk (MINA) plans to conduct a rights issue, issuing 3.281 billion new shares, equivalent to 33.33% of its fully paid and placed capital, at IDR 50 per share, potentially raising IDR 164.06 billion. The company's stock price has surged over 50% in the last three days following the announcement.

PT Star Pacific Tbk, a subsidiary of Lippo Group, has divested its stake in PT Bank Nationalnobu Tbk to Hanwha Life Insurance Co Ltd, a South Korean insurer, on June 26, 2025. The transaction marks Hanwha Life's expansion into Indonesia's banking sector.

The Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.29% to Rp 16,246 per US dollar on Wednesday, with the Jisdor rate also correcting 0.27% to Rp 16,236. The depreciation is not solely driven by the strengthening of the US dollar, according to Sutopo Widodo, President Commissioner of HFX International Berjangka.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 0.49% to 6,881.24 on Wednesday, with foreign investors net selling IDR 1.23 trillion worth of shares. The decline was partly driven by weak manufacturing data, which showed a contraction in the national manufacturing industry for three consecutive months.

Eight companies in Indonesia launched their initial public offerings (IPOs) on the same day, July 2, 2025, raising a total of IDR 3.38 trillion. The IPOs offered 18.5 billion shares to investors, with one company targeting IDR 2.37 trillion in funding.

The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources aims to increase oil lifting to 605,000-610,000 barrels per day in 2026, with a current realization of 567,900 barrels per day as of May 2025. The ministry is optimistic about reaching the target of 605,000 barrels per day by the end of the year.

Indonesia's coal exports decreased by 19.1% year-over-year to $10.26 billion in the first five months of 2025, compared to $12.68 billion in the same period last year. The volume of coal exports also fell by 4.65% to 156.37 million tons during the same period.

PT Total Bangun Persada Tbk (TOTA) has realized new contracts worth IDR 2.49 trillion in the first half of 2025, achieving 49.75% of its IDR 5 trillion target for the year. The company's corporate secretary, Anggie S. Sidharta, stated that the new contracts are in line with the company's target.

The Indonesian government is confident it will avoid retaliatory tariffs from the US, which could be as high as 40%, and is aiming for 0% tariffs in negotiations set to take place on July 8-9, 2025. The government is determined to reach a deal, with the deadline for trade negotiations fast approaching.

Indonesia's consumer price index (CPI) returned to inflation in June 2025, with a monthly inflation rate of 0.19% and an annual inflation rate of 1.87%. This marks a reversal from the deflation of 0.37% in May 2025.

Indonesia's state assets have increased to IDR 13.692 trillion by December 2024, up from IDR 13.072 trillion in 2023, according to the Ministry of Finance. The country's financial position is solid, with total assets reaching IDR 13.692 trillion, said Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati.

Indonesia's export performance in May 2025 reached $24.61 billion, an 18.66% monthly increase and a 9.68% annual growth, according to BPS. The improvement is attributed to the easing of the US-China trade war and its positive impact on the country's trade balance.

Indonesia's 2025 budget deficit is projected to reach IDR 662 trillion, or 2.78% of the country's gross domestic product, according to Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati's report to the House of Representatives. This is wider than the initial target, despite President Prabowo Subianto's efforts to improve budget efficiency.

The Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) for Indonesia's manufacturing sector fell to 46.9 in June, down from 47.4 in the previous month, indicating continued pressure on the sector. The decline suggests that consumer purchasing power has not improved, contributing to the country's gloomy economic outlook.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) fell 0.18% to 6,915.36 on Tuesday, with foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 696.03 billion. The market responded negatively to the decline in Indonesia's Purchasing Manager's Index (PMI) to 46.9, indicating a contraction in the manufacturing sector for three consecutive months.

The Indonesian rupiah appreciated 0.23% to IDR 16,200 per US dollar on Tuesday, supported by a risk-on sentiment and positive Chinese manufacturing data. The Caixin China PMI manufacturing index rose to 50.4 from 48.3 previously.

Danareksa, a state-owned investment management company, has been under scrutiny for its investment strategy, particularly in its treatment of publicly listed subsidiaries, such as PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI). The company's decision to distribute 78% of its net profit as dividends to shareholders has raised concerns among minority investors, who are also affected by its investment decisions.

The Indonesian government has accelerated subsidized housing development, with the Housing Financing Liquidity Facility (BP Tapera) disbursing 120,976 units in the first semester of 2025, a 44.50% increase compared to the same period last year. This marks a significant step towards providing affordable housing to the population.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) fell 0.18% to 6,915.36 on the first day of the second semester of 2025, extending its decline to 2.32% year-to-date. The index has been trending downward since the first semester of 2025.

PT Bukit Asam Tbk (PTBA) is expected to continue facing challenges due to oversupply and weak demand from China and India, but recent trade easing between the US and China may provide a limited potential for recovery. The company's long-term prospects remain attractive due to its logistics strengthening plans and dividend track record.

PT Prodia Widyahusada Tbk (PROD) has acquired 30% ownership of PT Prodia Stemcell Indonesia, a stem cell therapy service provider, as part of its long-term strategy to expand diagnostic services. The move aims to enhance personalized and modern diagnostic services.

SBS Co Ltd, a South Korean broadcasting company, is participating in PT MD Entertainment Tbk's rights issue, which will see the issuance of up to 989.77 million new shares, equivalent to 9.09% of the company's fully paid and placed capital. The move is part of PT MD Entertainment Tbk's capital increase plan.

PT Dyandra Promosindo (DYAN) is optimistic about the meeting, incentives, and conferences industry prospects until 2026, with several high-profile events planned for the second half of 2025 and 2026, including the Jakarta Wedding Festival on August 15-17, 2025. The company's confidence is reflected in its event lineup, which is expected to drive growth in the industry.

The Indonesian government has announced the deregulation of its import policy, removing restrictions on 10 commodities, effective immediately. This move is expected to have significant implications for the country's trade and economy.

PT Phapros Tbk (PEHA) projects a sales growth of over 20% year-on-year in 2025, driven by a 17.32% increase in sales to IDR 200.67 billion in Q1-2025, led by strong growth in over-the-counter and prescription medicine segments.

Bank Mandiri (BMRI) is expected to face net interest margin pressure in Q2 due to elevated funding costs, but loan growth momentum is expected to pick up in the second half of 2025 as liquidity improves. The bank's five-month performance showed a 13.6% year-on-year increase in loan growth, but net interest income only rose 4.2% year-on-year due to higher funding costs.

Indonesia's President Prabowo Subianto has launched a sovereign wealth fund, Daya Anagata Nusantara, to manage and develop the country's strategic assets, including state-owned enterprises and vital national assets, with a broader mandate than its predecessor, Indonesia Investment Authority.

Sinar Mas Group, through its subsidiary PT Dian Swastatika Sentosa Tbk, has established a joint venture with PT Trina Mas Agra Indonesia to operate a large-scale solar panel factory, capitalizing on the growing demand for renewable energy projects in Indonesia. The factory is expected to contribute to the growth of the domestic solar panel industry.

Banking stocks in Indonesia, including Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS), have declined due to global and domestic economic pressures, with BRIS shares falling 2.71% to IDR 2,740 and 7.35% year-to-date. The decline is attributed to economic uncertainty and analysts expect further volatility.

Bank Indonesia reported a 4.5% annual growth in working capital credit disbursement in May 2025, reaching IDR 3,432.1 trillion, driven by economic challenges and consumer purchasing power pressures. This growth is an improvement from April 2025, which saw a 4.3% annual growth.

Indonesian banks have reduced provisioning costs despite a rise in non-performing loans, which increased to 2.24% in April 2025 from 2.17% in March 2025. Banks believe they have sufficient provisions, allowing them to cut costs.

As the motor vehicle financing market in Indonesia shows no signs of improvement, industry players are turning to multifunctional products to drive business growth. PT Adira Dinamika Multi Finance Tbk (ADMF) is focusing on cash financing to maintain a balanced financing volume.

The Indonesian Financial Authority is investigating a complaint from an investor who was charged IDR 1.8 billion by Ajaib Sekuritas' trading app. The authority is looking into the matter further to determine the cause of the issue.

PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk (MEDC) has started commercial operations of its geothermal power plant in Ijen and solar power plant in Bali through its subsidiary, PT Medco Power Indonesia, on June 26, 2025, marking the company's expansion into the renewable energy sector, which is expected to boost its stock sentiment in the short term.

The Water Indonesia 2025 expo, part of the Indonesia Energy & Engineering Series 2025, aims to promote sustainable water management and investment in the sector, with companies like Wilo Pumps Indonesia, Mitra Bangunan Abadi, and Hoco Asia Industry showcasing their latest innovations. The event is expected to attract industry players, policymakers, and technology providers to discuss solutions to Indonesia's water management challenges, with the government targeting investments of up to Rp 26,380 trillion in water infrastructure by 2030.

The LQ45 index, comprising liquid stocks on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, has underperformed in the first semester of 2025, dropping 6.53% year-to-date, while the IHSG index weakened 2.15% in the same period. This decline is a significant setback for the Indonesian stock market.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia increased by IDR 16,000 per gram to IDR 1,896,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 16,000 per gram to IDR 1,740,000 per gram, according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang. This marks a significant increase in the gold price in the country.

The Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.27% to Rp 16,238 per US dollar on Monday, amid market anticipation of a China-US trade deal and developments in the Middle East. Meanwhile, the rupiah strengthened 0.01% to Rp 16,231 per dollar in the Jisdor Bank Indonesia.

The global financial market has started to move positively in the last month, driven by improving trade relations between the US and China, as well as reduced tensions in the Middle East, according to Djoko Soelistyo, Head of Investment & Insurance Product at DBS Indonesia (DBS). This development is expected to impact the global economy and financial markets in the second half of 2025.

Indonesia's economy is plagued by a paradox, with rich natural resources and human capital, yet high levels of poverty and inequality, with 68.3% of the population living in poverty in 2024, according to the World Bank. President Prabowo Subianto aims to address this issue by targeting 8% economic growth in the medium term, inspired by China's economic success.

PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk (PJKA) has received shareholder approval to conduct a 1:10 stock split, effective July 10, 2025, which could split the current share price of IDR 12,600 to IDR 1,260 per share. The company's shares surged 5.66% to IDR 12,600 on the Indonesia Stock Exchange following the announcement.

The Indonesian stock market closed at 6,927.67 on Monday, up 0.44%, despite foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 358.96 billion. Investors are now waiting for the May 2025 trade balance data, which is expected to show a surplus of USD 2.53 billion.

PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGAS) is facing challenges due to uncertainty in gas supply and distribution margin pressure, but strategic initiatives such as shifting export gas to the domestic market are expected to support long-term business sustainability. The company has reached an agreement with West Natuna Group to reallocate gas previously allocated for export to Singapore to the domestic market.

PT Jasa Marga Tbk (JSMR) reported an increase in vehicle volume on toll roads during the long weekend holiday, coinciding with a discount on toll road tariffs. The company saw a surge in traffic on H-1 and Hari H (New Year's Day) of the Islamic calendar.

PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) and Indonesia Battery Corporation (IBC) are set to collaborate with Ningbo Contemporary Brunp Lygend Co Ltd, a joint venture between CATL, Brunp, and Lygend, on an electric vehicle (EV) battery project. The project consists of six joint ventures, with ANTM and IBC partnering with Ningbo Contemporary Brunp Lygend Co Ltd on different scopes of the project.

Indonesia's industrial confidence index slowed down to 51.84 in June, affected by escalating geopolitical tensions, with a 0.27 point decrease from May and a 0.66 point decrease from June last year. Despite the slowdown, the index remains in the expansion phase.

PT Japfa Comfeed Indonesia Tbk (JPFA) has imported 1,100 crossbreed cows from Australia through its subsidiary PT Santosa Agrindo Lestari, in partnership with PT Greenfields Dairy Indonesia, to support the government's program to increase fresh milk production in the country. The cows will be distributed to 120 local dairy farmers in East Java.

The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources reported that the electricity subsidy outlook for 2025 may reach IDR 90.32 trillion, exceeding the allocated budget of IDR 87.72 trillion. The increase in subsidy needs is attributed to the volatility of the rupiah exchange rate and Indonesian crude price.

PT Perdana Gapuraprima Tbk (GPRAP) has allocated IDR 400 billion for capital expenditure this year, which will be used for expansion plans, including the development of new products in several residential projects. The company will focus on developing several residential projects, including Puri Semanan Residence in Jakarta, Botanica Signature Padjadjaran in Bogor, and Botanica in Cibubur.

PT Samudera Indonesia Tbk (SMDR) is planning to expand its fleet and strengthen its operations to meet increasing cargo transportation demand, with a capital expenditure of USD 236-250 million. The funding will come from a combination of internal cash, bank loans, and sukuk issuance.

PT Indo Tambangraya Megah Tbk (ITMG) is diversifying its business from coal to nickel, a key component in electric vehicle battery production, leveraging Indonesia's largest nickel reserves in the world, with 17.7 billion tons of ore and 177.8 million tons of metal.

The Indonesian government has deregulated the import of 10 commodities, including forestry products, subsidized fertilizers, and chemical raw materials, by revoking the Trade Minister's Regulation No. 36/2023 and Permendag No. 8/2024, affecting 482 Harmonized System tariff positions. This move aims to boost the country's economy amid the ongoing trade war and sluggish demand.

The Indonesian government has promised to improve national rice trade regulations after a survey in June 2025 found 211 rice brands, including premium and medium types, violating regulations, including rice adulteration. The government will give producers who violated regulations time to improve before taking repressive measures.

The merger plan between Adira Finance (ADMF) and Mandala Multifinance (TBK) is set to take effect on October 1, 2025, with Adira Finance becoming the surviving entity. The deal has received approval from shareholders and the financial authority, paving the way for the creation of a larger financial entity.

Indonesia's national competitiveness ranking fell from 27th to 40th in the 2025 World Competitiveness Ranking, reversing the positive trend of the past two years. The country now ranks in the bottom half of the 69 countries surveyed.

Bank Indonesia reported a 5.1% year-over-year increase in motor vehicle credit disbursal to IDR 144.6 trillion in May 2025, despite a decline in other consumer credit segments. This growth is notable, as other segments such as housing credit and multi-purpose credit experienced slower growth or stagnation.

In January 2025, Indonesian life insurance companies invested IDR 124.6 trillion in stocks, but the amount dropped to IDR 112.5 trillion the following month. The industry is taking advantage of the decline in the composite stock price index to accumulate stocks.

According to Mandiri Spending Index, Indonesian consumer spending increased by 5%-8% during the long holiday period in May 2025, driven by middle-to-upper class consumers. The index reached 269.5, compared to an estimated 249.0 without the holiday period.

Indonesia is close to finalizing trade negotiations with the US, with a deadline of July 8-9, 2025, for the implementation of tariffs. The Indonesian government has submitted a second offer, which has been accepted, and is in continuous communication with the US Trade Representative, Commerce Minister, and Finance Minister.

The credit quality of Indonesian micro, small, and medium enterprises (UMKM) has deteriorated, with the non-performing loan ratio increasing from 3.76% in December 2024 to 4.49% in May 2025, according to Bank Indonesia data, prompting industry players to strengthen risk mitigation efforts to manage claim burdens.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) rose 0.44% to 6,927.68 on the last trading day of the first half of 2025, despite a 3.46% decline in June and a 2.15% decline since the start of the year. The index had stood at 7,175.82 at the end of May 2025.

Eight companies, including PT Chandra Daya Investasi TBK and PT Diastika Biotekindo TBK, have completed the book building schedule and are preparing for their initial public offering. The companies are expected to list on the Indonesian stock exchange, with the exact dates yet to be announced.

Bank Permata TBK's market capitalization has grown significantly, reaching IDR 117.95 trillion as of Monday, with a 244.98% increase since the beginning of the year. This surge in market capitalization has made the bank an attractive target for investors who are looking beyond the big banks.

The Indonesian House of Representatives has stressed the importance of increasing national palm oil production to support the mandatory biodiesel 40% program, which requires around 15.6 million kiloliters of crude palm oil per year. The government plans to upgrade the program to biodiesel 50% next year, and has urged the Agriculture Ministry and other related institutions to accelerate implementation of intensification and extensification programs for palm plantations.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 4,000 per gram, from Rp 1,884,000 to Rp 1,880,000, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 4,000 per gram, from Rp 1,728,000 to Rp 1,724,000. This change is reflected in the prices offered by Logam Mulia, a subsidiary of PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM).

Indonesia's mutual fund industry has seen significant growth, with the number of investors increasing to 15 million in May 2025 and assets under management rising to IDR 503 trillion. The industry is expected to face challenges with new regulations, including the Miku policy, which aims to strengthen investment managers' capital and competitiveness.

Indonesia's trade balance is projected to record a significant surplus of $2.29 billion in May 2025, driven by the recovery of export activities and easing of global uncertainty. This surplus is significantly higher than the $158.8 million realized in April 2025, according to Josua Pardede, Head of Economics at Bank Permata (PERMATA).

The Indonesian consumer price index is predicted to return to inflation in June 2025, driven by increases in food prices, with a monthly inflation rate of 0.08% expected, reversing the deflation of 0.37% in May 2025, according to Josua Pardede, Head of Economics at Bank Permata (PERMATA).

Indonesia's national budget execution for 2025 has fallen short of expectations, with a remaining budget of IDR 303.8 trillion as of May 2025, resulting from a IDR 324.8 trillion budget realization and IDR 21 trillion budget deficit. This shortfall is a significant concern for the country's economic stability.

Indonesia's competitiveness ranking fell from 27th to 40th out of 69 countries in the 2025 World Competitiveness Ranking report, with declines in efficiency, business, and infrastructure. The report was released by the Institute for Management Development's World Competitiveness Center in June 2025.

The Indonesian government has introduced the 'Fiktif Positif' principle, which allows business license applications to be automatically approved if no response is received from authorities within a certain timeframe. This move aims to increase efficiency and transparency in the licensing process and boost investment in the country.

Industrial metal prices, including aluminum, tin, and nickel, have seen a positive trend despite global economic uncertainty, with aluminum prices rising 2.14% to $2,598.8 per ton, tin prices increasing 4.21% to $33,749 per ton, and nickel prices up 1.43% to $15,230 per ton over the past week.

The Indonesian rupiah is predicted to continue its strengthening trend this week, driven by the weakening US dollar, with the rupiah spot rate closing at Rp 16,195 per dollar on Friday, a 0.09% decrease from the previous day, and a 1.23% increase over the past week.

The consumer sector in Indonesia has not shown significant signs of recovery in the first half of 2025, with weak purchasing power and a trend towards more affordable products. According to Kiwoom Sekuritas Indonesia's equity research, global uncertainty may drive up costs for consumer goods companies, while slowing purchasing power also remains a concern.

The Indonesian stock market index rose 0.96% to 6,897.4 ahead of the long weekend, despite a 0.14% decline over the past week, driven by foreign net buying of Rp 2.2 trillion, including a Rp 3.8 trillion transaction of PT Bank Nationalnobu Tbk (BNOU) shares.

The Indonesian government has launched an investigation into high rice prices in the market despite an increase in rice production, with samples being taken from 10 provinces between June 6-23, 2025. The investigation involves the Ministry of Agriculture, the National Police, and other related agencies.

PT Kopi Fore Indonesia Tbk is set to continue its expansion with a capital expenditure of Rp 220 billion by the end of 2025, funded entirely by its initial public offering (IPO) proceeds of Rp 379.76 billion in April. The company plans to open new outlets this year.

PT Pertamina EP Prabumulih Field has reported a significant oil and gas discovery in the Lembak block, Sumatra Selatan, with initial production tests showing 1,814 barrels of oil per day and 1.7 million standard cubic feet of gas per day, exceeding targets by 361% and 485% respectively. The discovery was made using the Pertamina Drilling Services Indonesia (PDSI) rig #29.3, which has a capacity of 1,500 horse power.

Several Indonesian stocks have shown high returns despite the market downturn, with PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk (SSDI) leading the way with a 402.93% year-to-date increase, followed by PT Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima Tbk (SIAP) with a 191.52% increase and PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) with a 101.96% increase.

The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has decided to keep electricity tariffs for non-subsidized customers unchanged for the third quarter of 2025, aiming to boost people's purchasing power and industrial competitiveness. This decision is expected to support national economic growth and improve the competitiveness of industries.

PT Caturkarda Depo Bangunan TBK (DEPO) is optimistic about reaching its sales target of over IDR 3 trillion this year, driven by its expansion strategy, with a projected net profit of over IDR 95 billion. In 2024, the company recorded IDR 2.81 trillion in sales and IDR 95.24 billion in net profit.

Indonesia's President Prabowo Subianto has launched a $5.9 billion electric vehicle battery ecosystem project, a joint venture between Antam (ANTM), IBC, and CBL, marking a significant milestone in the country's efforts to develop its electric vehicle industry. The project, which was initiated four years ago during the presidency of Joko Widodo, aims to create an integrated ecosystem for electric vehicle batteries.

The Indonesian sovereign wealth fund, Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Andalan Nusantara, has instructed state-owned enterprises (BUMN) to hold their annual shareholder meetings (RUPS) by June, as required by law. This comes after the fund previously prohibited non-publicly traded BUMN from holding RUPS in early May.

The Indonesian Life Insurance Association reported a 1.5% year-over-year decline in premium income from life insurance agents, reaching IDR 13.9 trillion in Q1-2025, following a 2.4% decline in January-March 2024. The decline is attributed to the decreasing popularity of unit-linked products and the increasing use of digital channels.

PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) has launched a $5.9 billion electric vehicle battery ecosystem project, one of several large-scale projects by Indonesian state-owned enterprises. The project is developed in collaboration with Indonesia Battery Corporation and CATL.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) surged 0.96% or 65.26 points to 6,897.40 in the last trading session, despite still recording a 0.14% decline over the four-day trading period from June 23-26, 2025.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) has been weakening, down 2.58% since the start of the year, and is expected to remain limited in growth by the end of 2025, but Maybank Sekuritas Indonesia maintains its target of 7,300 for the year, assuming a 6% growth in earnings per share.

PT Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul Tbk (SIDO) aims to improve its performance in the remaining 2025 period after experiencing a decline in the first quarter. The company's sales grew well year-on-year in April-May, resulting in a positive increase in its first-half 2025 performance compared to the first quarter.

Indonesian coal miners are realigning their strategy to focus on domestic sales and smelting due to shrinking export opportunities, with thermal coal exports to China and India dropping 12.3% and 14.3%, respectively, in the first five months of 2025. Miners are also urging the government to roll back regulations that add financial strain to the already challenging market.

Surono Subekti, an experienced individual investor, has increased his stake in PT Brigit Biofarmaka Teknologi Tbk (BRBF) to 8.89% by acquiring an additional 310,000 shares, bringing his total holdings to 53,310,000 shares. This move marks a significant increase in his ownership of the company.

Despite the news of a ceasefire between Iran and Israel on June 24, the Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) failed to rise, instead experiencing a correction. Meanwhile, most global stock markets moved upwards during the same period.

Djarum Group, through its entity PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan, acquired 559.185 million shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk, a hospital network operator, at a price of IDR 1,875 per share, valuing the transaction at around IDR 1.05 trillion. This acquisition expands Djarum Group's investment portfolio.

Indonesia's national cement consumption decreased by 4.6% in May 2025 due to normalization of demand from the new capital city project and ongoing purchasing power challenges. This decline is expected to continue for several months, affecting the performance of major cement producers such as Semen Indonesia (SMGR) and Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP).

President Prabowo is set to launch the groundbreaking of the Feni Haltim energy project in Halmahera Timur, Maluku Utara on June 29, 2025, with an investment value of $6 billion or approximately Rp 97.8 trillion. The project will establish a new energy zone based on nickel as a raw material.

The Indonesian Anti-Corruption Commission (KPK) is investigating alleged corruption in the procurement of goods and services, specifically EDC machines, at PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BRI). The KPK has summoned former BRI Vice President Director Catur Budi Harto for questioning, but has not yet named any suspects.

Indonesia's tax revenue in Semester I-2025 is expected to contract 35-40% compared to the same period last year, which recorded IDR 885 trillion. This contraction is predicted despite an assumption of positive growth in other tax revenues.

The Directorate General of Taxes is finalizing regulations to appoint marketplaces as tax collectors for online sellers, with a 0.5% final income tax rate applicable to micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises with annual sales above IDR 500 million. Online sellers with sales below IDR 500 million will be exempt from the tax.

Merry Riana Education, a Indonesian education company, is set to launch its initial public offering (IPO) on the Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) on July 9, 2025, despite challenging market conditions. The company's founder and commissioner, Merry Riana, remains optimistic about the listing, citing the company's organic growth since 2014.

Indonesia's government is facing fiscal pressure this year, with a budget deficit since the beginning of the year, and is considering increasing bond issuance to address the issue, with a current deficit of Rp 21 trillion or 0.09% of GDP as of May.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 1.2% against the US dollar this week, closing at Rp 16,209 per dollar on Thursday, as the US dollar weakened. The rupiah also strengthened 1.01% against the dollar in the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (Jisdor) to Rp 16,233 per dollar.

Despite a challenging market, some Indonesian investment firms are working to improve their performance in the second half of 2025, following negative investment results in Q1 2025, with PT Saratoga Investama Sedaya Tbk (SRTG) reporting a net loss of IDR 6.85 trillion, a 197.82% increase from Q1 2024.
The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) rose 0.96% to 6,897.40 on Thursday, but still experienced a 1.02% decline over the past week. The index has been trending downward despite the daily gain.

PT Martina Berto Tbk (MBTO) reported a 3.2% year-over-year increase in revenue to IDR 431.6 billion in 2024, leading to an 86% improvement in net loss to IDR 4.46 billion. The company's bottom line improved significantly compared to a net loss of IDR 31.93 billion in 2023.

Indonesia's import system is seen as protectionist, with non-tariff measures hindering the meat industry, particularly for beef, which is mostly imported. The government is considering abolishing import quotas to increase availability and affordability of high-quality beef, supporting food security and consumer welfare.

Bank Indonesia reported a financial surplus of IDR 52.19 trillion in 2024, a 43.77% increase from IDR 36.3 trillion in 2023, driven by high revenue of IDR 228.66 trillion and expenses of IDR 161.3 trillion.

PT Metrodata Electronics Tbk (MTDL) is expanding its business lines, including selling and distributing Infinix smartphones, targeting positive growth in Indonesia's entry-level to mid-range market. The company aims to capitalize on increasing demand in this segment.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 17,000 per gram to Rp 1,907,000 per gram, while the buyback price also fell by Rp 17,000 per gram to Rp 1,751,000 per gram, according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM).

Deep Source Pte. Ltd., a Singapore-based company, is set to acquire 1.472 billion shares or 77.19% of PT Master Print Tbk's total issued and paid-up capital, valued at an undisclosed amount, making it the new controlling shareholder of Master Print.

PT Bangun Kosambi Sukses Tbk (BKSU) plans to conduct a share buyback with a maximum value of IDR 1 trillion through its subsidiary, PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk, over a three-month period from June 25, 2025, to September 24, 2025. The buyback is aimed at stabilizing the company's stock price and increasing shareholder value.

Badan Pengelola Investasi is set to invest $120 million in PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy TBK, a subsidiary of PT Pertamina (PERTM) in the energy sector. The investment, worth approximately IDR 1.9 trillion, was agreed upon several weeks ago, according to Chief Investment Officer Pandu Sjahrir.

PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk (MEDC) has signed an agreement with Repsol E & P, S..r.l. to acquire a 24% stake in the Corridor block from Fortuna International Inc for $425 million. The transaction is expected to be completed in Q3-2025.

Merry Riana Education TBK is set to launch its initial public offering (IPO) on the Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) on July 9, 2025, despite current challenging market conditions. The company remains optimistic about its listing plans.

PT Eka Sari Lorena Transport Tbk (LRNA) is struggling to overcome various challenges in the bus transportation industry, aiming to improve its financial performance after a disappointing 2024. The company's overall business segment performance was unsatisfactory last year.

Several Indonesian investment firms, including PT Saratoga Investama Sedaya Tbk. (SRTG), are working to improve their performance in the second half of 2025 after reporting negative investment results in the first quarter. These efforts come amidst fluctuations in the Indonesian stock market.

Indonesia is set to launch a new energy zone in Halmahera Timur, Maluku Utara, in June 2025, which will be the country's first battery energy industrial zone, developed in partnership with Chinese investors and state-owned enterprises. The zone will focus on nickel-based energy production.

The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has announced that global conglomerates and contractors are interested in expanding geothermal energy in Indonesia. This move is expected to boost the country's renewable energy sector and attract significant investments.

Several national banks in Indonesia are hosting large events, such as concerts and marathons, to attract new customers and increase digital transactions. Bank Tabungan Negara (BTN) is expecting a 15-20% increase in transactions and digital service activations through its Jakarta International Marathon event.

Medco Group's Ijen geothermal power plant, located in Banyuwangi, offers a unique look into renewable energy with its steam-powered turbines, producing electricity while maintaining a low environmental impact. The plant, operated by Medco Energi Internasional (MEDC), is a key project for the company's green energy initiatives.

BI-Fast transactions reached 393.73 million, a 45.45% year-over-year increase, with a total value of IDR 969.43 trillion, a 38.17% year-over-year increase, driven by massive digital banking adoption and lower costs.

Lo Kheng Hong has increased its stake in PT Salim Ivomas Pratama Tbk (SIPD), a palm oil plantation company, to 5.02% with 778,857,000 shares. This is an increase from the previous day, when Lo Kheng Hong did not hold more than 5% of the company's shares.

Bank Negara Indonesia's net interest margin (NIM) is expected to decline in Q2 2025, driven by softer interest earnings, particularly in the corporate segment, with loan growth set to accelerate in the second half of the year. The bank's operational expenses are constrained by ongoing digital investment, which surged 33.4% year-over-year.

A research report by BRI Danareksa Sekuritas predicts that the long holiday in Q2 2025 will not significantly increase data traffic and SIM card sales for Indonesian telecom operators, with many operators still distributing old stock with large discounts. The report highlights the uneven absorption of SIM cards, particularly offline.

The Indonesian Palm Oil Association (GAPKI) has proposed the establishment of a committee to accelerate the certification process of palm oil under the Indonesian Sustainable Palm Oil (ISPO) scheme, with only 58% of its 1,177 member companies having secured ISPO certificates for 3.6 million hectares of plantation areas.

Indonesian telco operators' data quota scheme is being criticized for allegedly causing consumer losses of up to tens of trillions of rupiah per year. The operators are defending their practice, citing business norms and ministerial regulations.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 8,000 per gram, from Rp 1,932,000 to Rp 1,924,000 per gram, while the buyback price also fell by Rp 8,000 per gram, from Rp 1,776,000 to Rp 1,768,000 per gram, according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang. This marks a decline in gold prices in the country.

The Indonesian stock market index fell 0.54% or 37.03 points to 6,832.143 on Wednesday, driven by pressure on big cap stocks, particularly in the banking sector. Despite this, Asian markets were mixed, with some gains seen amid hopes for a continued ceasefire between Iran and Israel and a positive response to the latest statement from the Federal Reserve governor.

PT Widodo Makmur Perkasa Tbk (WIDO) expects its revenue to reach IDR 830 billion by the end of the year, a 57% increase from IDR 539 billion in 2024. This growth is expected to have a direct impact on the company's operational performance and bottom line.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.33% to Rp 16,300 against the US dollar on Wednesday, driven by positive sentiment following the announcement of a ceasefire between Iran and Israel by US President Donald Trump. The currency's appreciation was also reflected in the spot market, where it gained 0.48% to Rp 16,292, according to Jisdor Bank Indonesia.

Several companies, including PT RMK Energy Tbk (RMKE), have announced plans to issue bonds and sukuk in the Indonesian stock exchange, with RMKE targeting to raise Rp 1.5 trillion from its bond issuance. The first phase of the issuance will involve Rp 500 billion in bonds.

PT Ifishdeco Tbk, a nickel mining company, plans to venture into the palm oil business with a 1,504.26 hectare land in Sulawesi. The company aims to diversify its business portfolio with this new venture.

PT Bangun Kosambi Sukses Tbk (BKSU) plans to conduct a share buyback with a maximum value of IDR 1 trillion over a three-month period from June 25, 2025, to September 24, 2025. The company, a subsidiary of PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PIKD), aims to implement this buyback strategy to support its business growth.

PT Indoritel Makmur Internasional Tbk (Indomaret) has opened 300 new stores in the first half of 2025, reaching 30% of its target of 1,000 new stores for the year. The company is taking a cautious approach to expansion, considering factors such as location selection.

The number of companies planning to go public in Indonesia has decreased, with only 14 companies in the pipeline with a total valuation of IDR 7.01 trillion, down from 102 companies in March 2025. This decline may be a sign of an impending economic crisis, as companies are hesitant to raise funds due to uncertain market conditions.

The Indonesian Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) has named a former director of PT Sritex (SRTX) as a suspect in a corruption case, complicating the company's bankruptcy process. The alleged corruption involves misused credit facilities from PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat and Banten and PT Bank DKI, which could lead to the seizure of Sritex's assets.

The Indonesian Parliament's Commission XI will conduct a fit and proper test on July 1, 2025, to select a new Deputy Governor of Bank Indonesia (BI) to replace Doni Primanto Joewono, whose term ends in July. The test will be held before the Commission submits its recommendations to the President.

In May 2025, Indonesian deposit rates surprisingly increased despite the central bank's rate cut, driven by competition among banks to attract deposits. The average 3-month deposit rate rose to 5.71% from 5.69% in April, while the 24-month rate increased to 4.38% from 4.34%.

PT Provident Investasi Bersama Tbk (PROVID) has received approval from its shareholders to implement strategic corporate actions, including a rights issue and a capital increase without pre-emptive rights. The approval was granted during an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders and an independent shareholders' meeting on Wednesday.

PT Apexindo Pratama Duta Tbk (APEX) aims to improve its performance by 2025 through rig utilization, following a 3.82% year-over-year decline in revenue to $22.87 million in Q1-2025. The company is taking steps to address its poor performance in the first quarter of this year.

The Indonesian mutual fund industry has recorded a positive achievement, with assets under management reaching IDR 806.5 trillion as of May, up 0.88% from the previous month. Despite this growth, the industry still faces risks, particularly from escalating geopolitical tensions and slowing economic growth.

PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk's (MTel) performance in the first three months of the year remains sluggish, but its strong dominance in the national market with a 44% market share helps maintain its solid position among digital infrastructure companies. The company's extensive national network, including areas outside of Java with long-term contract offerings, supports its market lead.

Djarum, through its subsidiary PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan, has acquired 559.185.300 shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk, a hospital operator, at a price of IDR 1.875 per share. The acquisition marks Djarum's expansion into the hospital sector.

The Indonesian government is set to impose income tax on online marketplace sellers, with the Directorate General of Taxes finalizing a legal framework to simplify tax administration and ensure fair treatment for micro, small, and medium-sized businesses. The move is expected to affect sellers on platforms such as Lokapasar.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 0.54% or 37.03 points to 6,832.14 on Wednesday, amid global financial uncertainty due to Middle East tensions. The decline marks a continued downward trend in the first half of 2025.

The Ministry of Investment and Batam authorities signed a memorandum of understanding on June 24, 2025, creating an investment desk in Batams free trade port zone to streamline permits via the OSS system and boost investment, which accounts for 2930% of Indonesias economy. The initiative, backed by the Ministrys investment desk and BP Batams licensing authority, aims to accelerate projects such as the AIdriven Nongsa Digital Park, Solar Home System initiative, and the Sekupang Health SEZ partnership with Mayapada Hospital, with Batam already attracting about US$6.09 billion in investment from Q1 2020 to 2025.

The Indonesian Investment Ministry has set up an investment desk in Batam's free trade port zone to accelerate investment realization and boost economic growth, with the region recording approximately $6.09 billion in investment from 2020 to Q1 2025. The initiative aims to improve the investment climate in Batam by enhancing transparency, efficiency, and responsiveness, with key projects including the AI-driven Nongsa Digital Park and the Solar Home System initiative.

The escalating conflict between Israel and Iran has sent shockwaves to the global energy market, causing a 9% surge in Brent crude prices, and Indonesia, as a net oil importer, is particularly vulnerable to the impact on its trade balance and fiscal condition.

The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has set the reference price for nickel at USD 15,221/ton and gold at USD 3,313.97/troy ounce for the second period of June 2025, representing a 1.19% decrease and 1.06% increase, respectively, compared to the previous period.

PT Jayamas Medica Industri Tbk (JMIF) is preparing to expand its market reach globally, capitalizing on the strategic opportunity to supply healthcare equipment amidst rising import tariffs imposed by the US on several countries, including China. The company sees potential for growth in the global market, driven by increasing demand for healthcare equipment.

PT Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada Tbk (CMNP) has decided not to distribute dividends for 2024, citing the need to focus on several projects in 2025, including the construction of two toll roads. The company will use its 2024 net profit to fund these projects.

The Kompas100 index has declined 5.87% since the beginning of the year, outpacing the 2.98% drop in the IHSG index, due to factors including the correction of large-cap stocks in the index. According to Mirae Asset's Head Research & Chief Economist, Rully Arya Wisnubroto, the decline is driven by several factors.

PT Bukit Asam (PTBA) is diversifying its business into non-coal sectors, focusing on renewable energy and coal downstreaming, with the goal of increasing non-coal business contributions to total revenue. The company is actively developing solar power plants and other renewable energy sources.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.84% to Rp 16,353 per US dollar following a ceasefire agreement between Iran and Israel, according to Bloomberg. The currency's movement remains uncertain, but the agreement has provided a positive impact on the rupiah's value.

Jantra Grupo Indonesia (JGRI) aims to achieve significant revenue growth in 2025, targeting IDR 74.3 billion, a 27.69% increase from 2024 projections, driven by network expansion and strategic partnerships. The company's director, Imam Sujono, announced the target, which is expected to drive business growth.

PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PIK2) is expanding its accessibility through the development of the Kamal-Teluknaga-Rajeg toll road and the Transjabodetabek T31 transportation system, which is expected to increase the number of visitors and support residential sales, with a target of Rp 5.31 trillion in revenue for 2025.

PT Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company Tbk (ULTJ) plans to buy back its shares with an allocation of IDR 1.45 trillion, funded from its internal cash reserves. The buyback will cover the cost of share repurchase, brokerage commissions, and other expenses.

Gold prices dropped 2.53% to $3,320.7 per ounce, while Antam's gold price fell 0.92% to IDR 1.93 million per gram, amid easing geopolitical tensions in the Middle East. The decline in gold prices is expected to continue its bearish trend.
